Package com.bitwise.decaf.editor.grammar

This package contains the user interface foundation for the contents of method bodies.

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
CodeNode.Listener Radio frequency for CodeNode communications.
Grammar.ClassReference  
Grammar.Content  
Officer.Foreign This empty interface denotes an officer that patrols one Grammar at the behest of another; typically such officers are delegates, such as the Deputy class.
Phrase.TypeChameleon Instances of Grammar.Content may additionally implement TypeChameleon if their content can be converted to other (most often primitive) types.
 

Class Summary
CodeNode CodeNode is the abstract base class for all nodes in the code tree under the DMethod.BodyGrammar.
CodeNode.Event The class of event object fired by this class.
EnforcementOfficer Realtime code validation is performed by subclasses of the EnforcementOfficer class, each of which patrols a single Grammar instance for compliance with a particular rule or set of rules (typically from the JLS.
EnforcementOfficer.ViolationWindow Displays the violation declared by an EnforcementOfficer
Grammar Grammar is a secondary base class of CodeNode, representing both Phrase and Sentence.
GrammarMask Within the context of a method body, the user has free reign to create whatever statements and expressions they wish (known here as phrases and sentences, respectively, and classified as grammars) .
Officer Derivations of the Officer class patrol instances of Grammar, which uses the method Officer.call() to set this officer to task.
Officer.Deputy A Deputy is an officer that reports all calls to its sherriff, which typically is the Officer that created it.
Paragraph  
ParagraphBox The standard editor component for a Paragraph.
Phrase Phrase is a transparent wrapper for a GExpression, holding its place in the code tree and providing a generic interface by which the editor can interact with it.
PhraseBox The standard component for displaying Phrase.
Sentence Sentence is a transparent wrapper for GStatement, holding its place in the code tree and providing a generic interface by which the editor can interact with it.
TypeOfficer This specialization of EnforcementOfficer maintains the current type of the Grammar it patrols.
 

Package com.bitwise.decaf.editor.grammar Description

This package contains the user interface foundation for the contents of method bodies. To avoid confusion with the base package org.hs.generator, I've chosen the aliases Phrase for Expression, Sentence for Statement, and Paragraph for Block. This package adds one layer to the source tree of a typical GSourceFile: each node contained in a method GMethod.body is wrapped in one of the aforementioned aliases, which act as placeholders for the code structure as constructs are created, modified and removed. These aliases extend the abstract base class CodeNode, and they each route the code generation calls encodeExpression() and encodeStatement() to the GConstruct they contain. Code constructs should always be displayed in their respective components PhraseBox, and ParagraphBox. The Grammar constructs Phrase and Sentence are equipped to be monitored by Officer instances, which validate code correctness as it is entered. When an EnforcementOfficer (subclass of Officer) finds error in a grammar, it sets that grammar's 'blue' property to true, which automatically places the offending line into the Review, available for the user's analysis when they are ready.
